text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem isolation-syndrome-factor-cs

This case-sensitive code system http://hl7.org/fhir/uv/aerospace/CodeSystem/isolation-syndrome-factor-cs defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
confinement ConfinementSmall volume, limited privacy, constrained movement.
sensory-monotony Sensory monotonyLimited visual, auditory, and olfactory variety.
interpersonal-friction Interpersonal frictionCrew tension, conflict, or poor communication.
role-ambiguity Role ambiguityUnclear or conflicting roles and responsibilities.
circadian-drift Circadian driftMisalignment of sleep-wake cycle with operational schedule.
communications-latency Communications latencyLong delays to ground communication reducing perceived support.
emergency-history Emergency historyRecent anomalies or near-miss events increasing stress load.
workload-imbalance Workload imbalanceUnequal distribution of work or perceived unfairness.

name: IsolationSyndromeFactorCS
title: Isolation Syndrome Factor Code System
description: Factors contributing to isolation, confinement, and psychosocial risk in aerospace missions.

concept.definition: Small volume, limited privacy, constrained movement.
Limited visual, auditory, and olfactory variety.
Crew tension, conflict, or poor communication.
Unclear or conflicting roles and responsibilities.
Misalignment of sleep-wake cycle with operational schedule.
Long delays to ground communication reducing perceived support.
Recent anomalies or near-miss events increasing stress load.
Unequal distribution of work or perceived unfairness.
